articles.content:
Committees for remembering Kim Il Sung formed abroad
   Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Committees for remembering the President Kim Il Sung are being formed one after another in different countries.   On June 15, an inaugural meeting of the Mongolian committee was held.   At the meeting, the chairman and vice-chairman of the committee were elected and its program was made public.   An inaugural meeting of a joint remembering committee of the Jordanian political parties and organizations held on June 9 set a period of remembering the president from June 25 to July 10 and decided to hold multifarious events in this period.

articles.content:
Evening gala of youth and students in Pyongyang
    Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- An evening gala of youth and students in Pyongyang was held at the Kim Il Sung Square on June 19 to commemorate the 35th anniversary of General Secretary  Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Worker's Party of Korea.   Jon Pyong Ho and other senior  party and state officials were present at the gala.   Invited to the gala were Koreans overseas on a visit to the socialist fatherland, diplomatic envoys and embassy officials here and foreign guests.   
   As the song "Receive our salute please"  reverberated far and wide, the square turned  into a veritable sea of dancers. The participants danced, representing the highest tribute and best wishes of the youth, students and people across the country to  Marshal Kim Jong Il, who has led the Worker's Party of Korea and the revolution to victory over the last 35 years of his great  guidance.    The festive mood reached the climax  when they danced to the tune of songs "Our Comrade Kim Jong Il" and "Let us sing of dear commander of people."
   On the same day, artists  presented performances at central and local theatres.

articles.content:
Working people and KPA soldiers make excursions
   Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Working people from all walks of life across the country and soldiers of the Korean People's Army made excursions to the secret camp in Mt. Paektu to commemorate the 35th anniversary of General Secretary  Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Worker's Party of Korea.
   Excursions of central, provincial and KPA soldiers groups followed that of officials and members of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea.
Before their start of excursions, they held a meeting before the statue of the President Kim Il Sung standing before the monument to the victorious Pochonbo Battle in Hyesan city, Ryanggang Province.
   They arrived at the secret camp in Mt. Paektu, visited a simple log cabin, where Kim Jong Il was born, and swore an oath of loyalty before the native home.
